messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using JavaScript and the Express.js framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To begin this process, I'll provide you with the contents of file `controllers/userController.js`, your task is to extract all instances of API entries from this file.

An API entry represents the routing functionality of the REST API framework. It refers to the structure that binds a partial or complete request path (called a "path") to a function, class, class method, or object (called a "handler") that processes requests matching that path, either by handling them directly or by dispatching them to other handlers based on the path.

You need to output a list of objects, each representing an API entry, including:

- The HTTP request path, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}). Set this to null if it cannot be determined.
- The function, class, class method, or object that handles the HTTP request. Use exactly "anonymous" to denote an anonymous implementation.
- Whether the handler's implementation (i.e., processing requests and building responses) is present in the same source code file, rather than being imported.
- Whether the path string is a prefix rather than a full path.
- Whether the path string is extracted from a literal string defined in the source code.
- Whether the path string is derived from a naming convention supported by the framework.
- Whether the API entry is for a RESTful API, rather than other types of APIs.
- Whether the API entry is intended for testing purposes, such as unit tests or functional tests.

Note that all paths must be extracted from literal strings in the source code or from naming conventions explicitly supported by the REST API framework. Do not make guesses, if you find a function, class, class method, or object that looks a lot like an API implementation, but the path is not explicitly defined in this file (perhaps in another file), do not include it in your output. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
[
  {
    "path": "/api/users/auth",
    "handler": "authUser",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users",
    "handler": "registerUser",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/logout",
    "handler": "logoutUser",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/profile",
    "handler": "getUserProfile",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/profile",
    "handler": "updateUserProfile",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users",
    "handler": "getUsers",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/{id}",
    "handler": "deleteUser",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/{id}",
    "handler": "getUserById",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/users/{id}",
    "handler": "updateUser",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "fromLiteral": true,
    "fromConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  }
]

Explanation:
- I extracted routes from the @route comment lines present in controllers/userController.js (e.g., "@route   POST /api/users/auth"). These comment strings are treated as literal route strings found in this file.
- Path parameters written as ":id" in the source were converted to the OpenAPI-style "{id}" syntax.
- Each object maps the path (as requested, beginning with "/") to the handler defined in this file (the const names exported at the bottom). All handlers are implemented in this same source file (the async arrow functions or the logoutUser function), so implementationPresent is true.
- isPrefix is false for all entries because the @route comments give full routes rather than prefixes.
- fromLiteral is true because the paths came from literal strings in the file's comments. fromConvention is false because no framework naming convention was used to derive paths here.
- All entries are standard REST endpoints (isRest: true) and none are test-only endpoints (isTest: false).
- Note: HTTP methods (GET/POST/PUT/DELETE) are present in the comments but the requested objects only require the path; handlers for the same path but different methods are represented as separate entries (e.g., POST /api/users -> registerUser and GET /api/users -> getUsers). If you need the HTTP methods included explicitly in the output, I can add a method field for each entry.
